_meanings:
<ab>N.</ab> of a sage. 
[According to Viṣṇu Purāṇa, he was the
tutor of Kṛṣṇa and Balarāma, and
asked, as his preceptor's fee that his son, 

who was kept by a demon named 
Panchajana underneath the waters, should
be restored to him. Kṛṣṇa, having
undertaken to get him up, plunged 
into the sea, killed the demon, and
brought back the boy to his father].
